page.title: 02Site and Situation
page.content: Todmorden lies in the valley of the River Calder, midway between Halifax, Rochdale and Burnley.The narrow valley floor carries the main roads, railway, and the river. Packhorse routes used to cross the moors above Todmorden, where small farming communites prospered.During the Industrial Revolution people moved down into the valley and settled along the main roads, the A646(T) and the A6033. Today the steep valley sides remain a physical barrier to the towns limits, so all building development has taken place along the valley floors in a (Y) shape. As Todmorden's population continues to decline, many people are moving back to the villages on the moors around Todmorden,e.g.Lumbutts and Mankinholes.
